About Me

Who I Am

I’m Diego Bergia, an electronics and automation enthusiast who loves building things that move, react, and interact. I enjoy experimenting with sensors, motors, and code to turn creative ideas into working prototypes. My goal is to merge engineering precision with curiosity and design.

What I Do

I develop interactive systems that combine ESP32, Jetson Nano and 3D printing. My work often connects physical hardware with intelligent behavior — whether it’s automation setups, escape room mechanisms, or smart devices reacting to people and the environment.

Tools & Skills

• Electronics: ESP32, Arduino, sensors, stepper drivers, relays
• Software: SolidWorks, Bambu Studio, Python, C/C++
• AI & Vision: Jetson Nano, OpenCV
• Prototyping: 3D printing, wiring, testing, documentation
